translation: Foshuo li deng jing

source_sentence: 西晉月氏國三藏竺法護譯
translation: Translated by Zhu Fahou, Tripiṭaka of the Yuezhi State, Western Jin Dynasty

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，婆伽婆在婆祇尸牧摩鼻量鹿野苑中。
translation: Thus I heard: One time, the Bhagavān was in the Deer Preserve of Vātsīputrīya.

source_sentence: 彼時，尊者大目乾連在摩竭善知識村。
translation: At the time, the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana was in the village of Maghā Good Teaching.

source_sentence: 彼尊者大目乾連，獨在靜處經行而睡，世尊知尊者大目乾連獨在靜處經行而睡。
translation: That Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana was walking and sleeping alone in a quiet place, and the Bhagavān knew that Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana was walking and sleeping alone in a quiet place.

source_sentence: 彼時世尊知尊者大目乾連獨在靜處經行睡已，即如其像三昧正受，以三昧意，猶若力士屈申臂頃，世尊亦如是，在婆祇尸牧摩鼻量鹿野苑中忽然不現，至摩竭善知識村，在尊者大目乾連前。
translation: After he knew that Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana was walking and sleeping alone in a quiet place, the Bhagavān then took refuge in samādhi like his image and correctly experienced it with the intention of samādhi, just like a strong man flexing his arms for a moment, so did the Bhagavān suddenly disappear in the Deer Preserve of Vātsīputrīya Mābiṅga and went to the village of Maghāra and stayed in front of Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana.

source_sentence: 彼時世尊從三昧起，告尊者大目乾連曰：「汝目乾連！
translation: The Bhagavān then rose from his samādhi and addressed Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, saying, "You, Maudgalyāyana!
You, Maudgalyāyana!
Do you wish to sleep?"
"Yes, it's true.
Bhagavān!"
"Why do you want to fall asleep because of mindfulness?

source_sentence: 莫行想，莫分別想，莫多分別，如是睡當離。
translation: Don't think of practice, don't think of discrimination, and don't make many distinctions; thus, you will part with your sleep.

source_sentence: 汝若睡不離者，汝，目乾連！
translation: If you don't part with your sleep, you, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 如所聞法，如所誦法，廣當誦習，如是睡當離。
translation: As you hear the teaching, as you recite the teaching, you should recite it extensively, and as you sleep, you should part with it.
If you don't part with it, you, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 如所聞法，如所誦法，當廣為他說，如是睡當離。
translation: As you hear the teaching and recite the teaching, you will explain it in detail for others, and thus you will sleep and avoid it.
If you don't part with it, you, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 如所誦法，如所聞法，意當念當行，如是睡當離。
translation: As you recite the teaching, as you hear the teaching, your mind will be mindful and act accordingly, and as you sleep, you'll be free of it.
If you don't part with it, you, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 當以冷水洗眼及洗身支節，如是睡當離。
translation: You must wash your eyes and the limbs of your body with cold water, and thus you must part with your sleep.
If you don't part with them, you, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 當以兩手相挑兩耳，如是睡當離。
translation: You must pick your ears with your two hands, and thus you'll be able to sleep without them.
If you don't part with them, you, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 當起出講堂，四方視及觀星宿，如是睡當離。
translation: You must get up and leave the lecture hall, look in all directions, and examine the stars; thus, you must leave when you're asleep.
If you don't leave, you, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 當在空處仿佯行，當護諸根，意念諸施，後當具想，如是睡當離。
translation: You must imitate modest behavior in an empty place, guard your faculties, be mindful of generosity, and subsequently conceptualize it; thus, you must sleep and avoid it.
If you don't part with it, you, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 當還離仿佯，舉尼師壇敷著床上，結跏趺坐，如是睡當離。
translation: He must then return to his bed, spread out his sitting mat, sit cross-legged, and sleep like this.
If you don't part with it, you, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 當還入講堂，四疊敷欝多羅僧著床上，舉僧伽梨著頭前，右脇著床上，足足相累，當作明想，當無亂意，常作起想思惟住。
translation: Going back into the lecture hall, he spreads four layers on a bed, puts his head in front of his head, puts his right hypochondrium on the bed, puts his feet together, and makes a bright thought that he'll always contemplate without confusion.
"You, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 莫樂床、莫樂右脇眠、莫樂睡、莫樂世間恭敬以為味。
translation: Don't delight in your bed, don't delight in sleeping on your right side, don't delight in sleeping, and don't delight in worldly respect as a taste.
Why is that?
Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 我不說近一切法，我亦不說不近一切法。
translation: I don't speak near all dharmas, and I don't speak near all dharmas.
Why, Maudgalyāyana!
Do I say that I don't approach all dharmas?
You, Maudgalyāyana!
I said I wouldn't get close to the white coat.
Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 若親近白衣住者，但有論俱不與誦俱，因彼論便有諛諂憍慢，因有憍慢便有嫉妬，因嫉妬不知息。
translation: If someone who lives close to a white man only has discourses and doesn't recite aloud, then that discourse leads to flattery and pride, and because of pride there's jealousy, and because of jealousy they don't know how to stop it.
You, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 若有不息已，三昧便遠離，是為，目乾連！
translation: If there is no respite, then samādhi will be abandoned, and this is it, Maudgalyāyana!
"I say this is an unapproachable dharma.
Why, Maudgalyāyana!
Did I say "intimate with the Dharma"?
Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 當至靜處草蓐為床，默然不言，遠離諸惡、離人眾，常當坐思惟。
translation: He should go to a quiet place on a mat, be silent, and keep his distance from evil and from crowds of people, and always sit and contemplate.
Thus, Maudgalyāyana!
I'll explain the intimate dharma.
"Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 若入村乞食，當莫求利報，當莫求恭敬。
translation: If you go into a village to solicit alms, don't seek reward, and don't seek respect.
You, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 息利報恭敬意已，當入村乞食。
translation: After he rewards them with respect, he'll go into the village to solicit alms.
You, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 入村乞食，當莫以想入他家。
translation: "When you enter a village to beg for food, don't think about entering another person's house.
Why is that?
Maudgalyāyana!
A householder's household often has secular connections.

source_sentence: 若比丘入居士家不共言，彼比丘便作是念：『誰有向此居士護說我，而令居士不共我言？』
translation: If a monk enters a householder's home and doesn't share his words, that monk then thinks, 'Who has guarded me from this householder and caused him not to share my words?'

source_sentence: 便有恚心，有恚已便有貢高，因有貢高便有不息。
translation: Then there's anger, and after anger there's arrogance, and because of arrogance there's nonstopping.
Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 有不息意已，便遠離三昧。
translation: After having an unstirring mind, he then departs from samādhi.
You, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 若說法時當莫見勝負，當作不勝意。
translation: "When you explain the teaching, don't see victory or defeat, and assume an attitude of no victory.

source_sentence: 若作勝意便有多論，因多論便有貢高，因貢高便有嫉妬，因嫉妬便有不息。
translation: If you give superior intent, then there'll be lots of talk, and because of lots of talk there'll be pride, and because of pride there'll be jealousy, and because of jealousy there'll be no respite.
Maudgalyāyana!
After he doesn't stop, I'll explain seclusion samādhi.
You, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 若說法時當作有益，當決定說，當莫非他說，當如師子吼論。
translation: If you explain the teaching, you should make it helpful, you should say it with certainty, you shouldn't tell it to anyone else, and you should follow the lion's roar theory.
Thus, Maudgalyāyana!
Train yourselves in this way."

source_sentence: 於是尊者大目乾連從坐起，一面著衣，叉手向世尊，白世尊曰：「唯世尊！
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana then rose from his seat, put on his robe at one side, saluted the Bhagavān with his palms together, and said, "Only the Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 云何比丘，至竟盡、至竟無垢、至竟行梵行？」
translation: How does a monk attain the ultimate, final, undefiled, and final practice of the religious life?"
"This is Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 若比丘所有病痛，若苦若樂若不苦不樂，當觀彼痛是無常住，當觀是敗壞，當觀是無染，當觀是盡，當觀是正，當觀是止住處，當如是觀彼痛。
translation: "If a monk has pain that's painful, whether painful, pleasant, or neither painful nor pleasant, he should observe that pain as impermanent, as decaying, as undefiled, as ending, as correct, and as a place of cessation, and he should thus observe that pain.

source_sentence: 當觀彼痛無常住，當觀是敗壞，當觀是無染，當觀是盡，當觀是止，當觀是止住；便不著此世間，不著已便不恐怖，不恐怖已捨有餘般涅槃，生便盡，梵行已成，所作已辦，名色已有知如真。
translation: When he observes that pain as impermanent, when he observes it as decaying, when he observes it as undefiled, when he observes it as ending, when he observes it as stopping, and when he observes it as standing still, he then doesn't become attached to this world, doesn't become frightened after not becoming attached, doesn't abandon parinirvāṇa with remainder after not becoming frightened, then he ends birth, has completed the religious practice, has accomplished what he's done, and knows name and form as they really are.
Thus, Monk Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 至竟盡、至竟無垢、至竟梵行、至竟行梵行。」
translation: Until the end, until the end is complete, until the end is unsullied, until the end is the religious practice, and until the end is the practice of the religious practice."
Thus did the Buddha speak.

source_sentence: 尊者目乾連聞世尊所說，歡喜而樂。
translation: Venerable Maudgalyāyana was delighted and rejoiced when he heard what the Bhagavān taught.
The Buddha taught the Sutra on Freedom from Sleep.
